step.cmd: Target Setup. Select a Symbian Device and the Qt Simulator.
Provide your UID3 and enable or disable network access.
Build to make sure your project compiles and the basic settings work correctly.

task.title: Copy the AppMeasurement Files to Your Project Folder

step.cmd: Copy the AppMeasurement.lib file to the libraries folder on your development workstation:
Copy the AppMeasurement.h and LibAppMeasurement.a files to a path within your project.

context.p: A sample QtCreator project that implements the AppMeasurmement Libraries for Symbian is available at the following URL:
Download and extract this project. The folder you select cannot contain any spaces in the entire path. After the sample project is extracted, complete the following to configure a basic project.

step.cmd: Right-click your project and select Add existing file. and browse to the AppMeasurement.h file.
Update the target capabilities by replacing the current symbian:TARGET.CAPABILITY values with the following:

stepresult.codeblock: symbian:TARGET.CAPABILITY += LocalServices Location NetworkServices ReadUserData UserEnvironment WriteUserData PowerMgmt ProtServ ReadDeviceData SurroundingsDD SwEvent TrustedUI WriteDeviceData
stepresult.p: Run qmake to apply the changes.

stepresult.codeblock: QT + next two other lines need to be added to the project as well. Then they run qmake and then compile and run. You should see the test hit go out in the Application Output.

step.cmd: Add the following to include the AppMeasurement header file:
As a test you can add a sample call in main.cpp.
